response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ["Age (21 years)", "medium", "Young age is associated with higher impulsivity and risk-taking, but at 21 the risk is moderate as many individuals are still developing."],
    ["Race (Identifies as Black)", "medium", "Research shows that minorities can face systemic disadvantages contributing to recidivism risk, though race itself isn't a behavioral risk factor."],
    ["Criminal History (1 arrest and conviction)", "medium", "A prior arrest and conviction indicate a history of offending, elevating risk slightly, though the limited history keeps it at medium."],
    ["Education (No high school diploma or GED)", "high", "Lack of formal education is strongly correlated with socioeconomic disadvantages and limited opportunities, increasing recidivism risk."],
    ["Employment History (2 jobs held during the year)", "medium", "Moderate employment history suggests some stability, but limited job retention in a challenging economic environment contributes moderate risk."],
    ["Mental Health (Recent periods feeling down)", "medium", "Experiencing depressive symptoms can impair judgment and stability, moderately increasing risk factors for recidivism."],
    ["Living Arrangement (Currently living alone)", "medium", "Living alone can reduce social support, slightly elevating the risk of recidivism."],
    ["Family Background (Lived with biological mother in urban setting during youth)", "medium", "Growing up in an urban environment with a small household may have exposed him to community-level risks, balancing both protective and risk dynamics."],
    ["Religious Belief (Believes God influences personal fate)", "low", "Religious faith can be a protective factor that encourages prosocial behavior, thus lowering recidivism risk."]
  ],
  "prediction": "YES",
  "confidence": 70
}

risk_factors: Young age is associated with higher impulsivity and risk-taking, but at 21 the risk is moderate as many individuals are still developing.
Research shows that minorities can face systemic disadvantages contributing to recidivism risk, though race itself isn't a behavioral risk factor.
A prior arrest and conviction indicate a history of offending, elevating risk slightly, though the limited history keeps it at medium.
Education (No high school diploma or GED)
Lack of formal education is strongly correlated with socioeconomic disadvantages and limited opportunities, increasing recidivism risk.
Employment History (2 jobs held during the year)
Moderate employment history suggests some stability, but limited job retention in a challenging economic environment contributes moderate risk.
Experiencing depressive symptoms can impair judgment and stability, moderately increasing risk factors for recidivism.
Living alone can reduce social support, slightly elevating the risk of recidivism.
Family Background (Lived with biological mother in urban setting during youth)
Growing up in an urban environment with a small household may have exposed him to community-level risks, balancing both protective and risk dynamics.
Religious Belief (Believes God influences personal fate)
Religious faith can be a protective factor that encourages prosocial behavior, thus lowering recidivism risk.

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is a 21-year-old male who identifies himself as Black. He has been arrested 1 time and has been convicted. He is 5 feet 5 inches and weighs 145 lbs. He has never been married and is currently living alone. He does not have a high school diploma or GED certificate and is not enrolled in college. He has held 2 jobs during the year. He has not used any drugs in the past four years and some of the time during the past month he has felt so down in the dumps that nothing could cheer him up. At a young age, he lived with his biological mother in a household of size 4, in an urban area. He considers that God has something to do with what happens to him personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
